Summary of financr Functions

Source: vignettes/Functions_summary.Rmd
Functions_summary.Rmd

This vignette explains the functions offered by 'financr'.

'financr' Overview

  • All the 'financr' functions return a standardized data.frame.
    • Functions with the '_historic' suffix return an historic of financial data,
    • while the others retrieve up-to-date data and latest financial insights.
Table 1. Overview of 'financr' Functions
Example Input Returned data.frame Data
get_indices() World indices, latest insights and values Latest‡
get_crypto() 100 major crypto-currencies, latest insights and values (USD) Latest‡
get_info_from_name('Saab') Free-texts, e.g., companies names Ticker symbol(s) associated with the text, latest insights and values Latest†
get_historic('AAPL') Ticker symbol(s)1 Historic of financial data Historic*
get_changes('USD', 'EUR') Currencies to convert Latest exchanges rates Latest‡
get_changes_historic('USD', 'EUR') Currencies + optional range and interval Historic of exchanges rates Historic*
valid_symbol("AAPL") Text(s) to verify Validity of financial symbol(s) Latest*

Sources :

  • * : Yahoo Finance APIs, e.g., query1.finance.yahoo.com/v1/finance/currencies ; […]/v8/finance/chart or query2.finance.yahoo.com/v6/finance, etc.
  • † : Scraping from https://finance.yahoo.com/lookup/
  • ‡ : Scraping from other Yahoo Finance pages, such as https://finance.yahoo.com/markets/world-indices/ or […]/markets/crypto, etc.

Standardized Return Conventions. Regarding all the data.frame returned by 'financr' functions:

The column names are:

  • following the ‘snake_case’ conventions, e.g., in lowercase and without spaces;
  • and symbols are replaced (e.g., “%’ is replaced by ‘percent’);

Regarding the values :

  • Numeric values are returned as integer or numeric class of values.

'financr' Specifics

Role of financr in the ‘Reach Yahoo Finance’ ecosystem. 'financr' only retrieves the data from Yahoo Finance and make no assumptions about the visualizations or analyses performed with these financial data. Consequently, financr dependencies are kept low.

Other R packages retrieves data from the same source as 'financr', i.e. Yahoo Finance. E.g., 'yahoofinancer', yfr, 'quantmod' and the packages that depends on them such as stocks that depends on 'quantmod'.

Regarding the fetching of historical financial values from Yahoo Finance, the returned objects of these packages have different properties, see below.

Table 2. 'financr' get_historic() Alternatives and Returned Values
Package get_historic
'financr' financr::get_historic() return a standard data.frame
'yahoofinancer' 'yahoofinancer' methods return an 'R6' class object (e.g., Ticker$get_history)
yfr yfr::yf_get() return a tibble
'quantmod' getSymbols() from the 'quantmod' package return a time series object ('xts' & 'zoo' object)

Other functions offered by these packages are sometimes more or less equivalent (e.g., financr::valid_symbol()) whereas other functions are specific to one of these packages. E.g., 'financr' offer free-text search with financr::get_info_from_name(), while 'quantmod' offers financial data-analysis oriented functions and time series data visualization methods. Other packages are derivated from these 2 examples, e.g., which rely on quantmod and ans.

  1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ticker_symbol↩︎

Developed by Clément Laverdet.
